channel.title: Client help. (compiling)
channel.description:
alright Im not sure if this is a very hard problem to fix.. But Ive been trying to fix it.. When i click compile i get this mssge.
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
When I click compile this is all thats in the notepad.
@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit
do i need to edit something?

item.title: Client help. (compiling)
item.dc:creator: @shark_tooter shark_tooter
item.description:
@shark_tooter wrote:

yes, to get people to connect you should enter your ip or your hamachi ip… Then run your server and you should be able to connect… If you use your ip then try to connect if your able to they will be able to as well. Also make sure to include your cache with your client… But you might want to take out all the .java files… Just an option.

Good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Client help. (compiling)
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

To learn why this error is caused:
http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/javaOO/annotations.html

Other than that, you don’ t have to fool around with anything. Its funny how everybody thinks that message is bad lol

Read full topic

item.title: Client help. (compiling)
item.dc:creator: @runyluny runyluny
item.description:
@runyluny wrote:

haha thanks! IVE BEEN WORKING ON THIS FOR WEEKS! dude how do i get ppl to connect to the client im using? do I go to GUI.Java and put my case my hamachi ip the click save and compile?

item.title: Client help. (compiling)

@shark_tooter wrote:

yeah, really… It means that it was successful… Goodjob compiling your “FIRST” program successfully.

item.title: Client help. (compiling)
item.dc:creator: @Woopzpkedu Woopzpkedu
item.description:
@Woopzpkedu wrote:

[quote=“runyluny, post:1, topic:372971”]alright Im not sure if this is a very hard problem to fix… But Ive been trying to fix it… When i click compile i get this mssge.

Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

When I click compile this is all thats in the notepad.

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

do i need to edit something?[/quote] u were tryng to fix it even if doesnt need fix?>

Read full topic

item.description:
@xXx_gl0wi_xXx wrote:

Lol, It means u succesfuly compiled

Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.

Press any key to continue . . .

“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
